title: "datalad status -e commit" takes 2+ hours
body:
#### What is the problem?
I am getting back to merging modifications to a master location. The data is 1.7Tb and is split in several subdatasets, total ~450 of which 440 are subject datasets in one of the bids folder. After merging some changes from another location, I am going back to the root superdataset to check if any subdataset is out of sync (i.e., the submodule registered in the parent dataset is not pointing to the last commit of the subdataset). I use `-e commit` to avoid thorough checks, but it takes almost 3 hours anyway:

```
[dorian@mri FEDERATED_DATASETS]$ time datalad status -e commit
nothing to save, working tree clean

real    0m0.272s
user    0m0.203s
sys     0m0.077s
[dorian@mri FEDERATED_DATASETS]$ time datalad status -e commit --recursive
nothing to save, working tree clean

real    169m26.862s
user    7m6.813s
sys     8m17.664s
```
Is this normal? Is my command correct for simply checking proper registration of latest commit of each subdataset into parent?

#### What steps will reproduce the problem?
Can't tell how to reproduce, try on a big superdataset.

#### What version of DataLad are you using (run `datalad --version`)? On what operating system (consider running `datalad wtf`)?
0.12.2 (installed from github yesterday)

#### Is there anything else that would be useful to know in this context?
No

#### Have you had any success using DataLad before? (to assess your expertise/prior luck.  We would welcome your testimonial additions to https://github.com/datalad/datalad/wiki/Testimonials as well)
Yes.
